content: The no argument constructors of java do not accept parameters. The use of constructor variables of a method with instances can be initialized having fixed values for objects.
Mostly a constructor which accepts parameters is needed. The parameters can be added to constructors as they are in methods by their declaration in constructors name.
The default constructors are automatically added in java as they initialize all the member variables with zero. but if one defines their own constructor, then the default constructors remove itself.
